com.github.xemiru.sponge.boxboy.util

Class Animation<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.xemiru.sponge.boxboy.util.Animation<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of the object representing the animation's frames

    public class Animation<T>
extends Object
    Helper class for creating animations using some kind of object.

    Animation timings using this class are per-instance and begin on the first call of getCurrentFrame().

    • Constructor Summary

        public Animation()

    • Method Detail

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        Returns whether or not this Animation has no frames.
        Returns:
        if this Animation has no frames

      • frame

        public Animation<T> frame(T obj,
                          long time)
        Adds a new frame to this Animation.

        The time specified is in milliseconds.

        Minecraft's update rate of 20 ticks per second sets the lowest effective value for this method to be 50ms (1/20th of a second).

        Parameters:
        obj - the object representing the frame and thus the object returned upon calling getCurrentFrame()
        time - how long the frame is displayed, in milliseconds
        Returns:
        this Animation, for chaining

      • isNewFrame

        public boolean isNewFrame()
        Returns whether or not the frame being currently returned by getCurrentFrame() is different from the one it previously gave.
        Returns:
        whether or not getCurrentFrame() returns a new frame

      • getCurrentFrame

        public T getCurrentFrame()
        Returns the object representing the current frame of this Animation.

        If there are no frames registered with this helper, an IllegalStateException is thrown stating so.

        If there is only one frame registered with this helper, that one frame's object is always returned.

        Otherwise, the animation timer is started (if it hasn't been yet), and the frame is retrieved based on the time passed since then.

        Returns:
        the object of the current frame

      • clone

        public Animation<T> clone()
        Returns a new Animation holding a copy of this one's frames.
        Overrides:
        clone in class Object
        Returns:
        a copy of this Animation
